libs.Hotspot.combined_models¶

Combined models are collections of models which are executed one after the other. Usual comined models corresponds to a local model + global one, for instance UDPPLocal and UDPPMerge, in order to allow for a easy end-to-end computation, also using the same api than other models. Some operations sometimes need to be performed between models, like recomputing cost vectors.

Functions

combine_model(Models_list[, ...])

Creates a model that combines sequentially the models in Models.

init_and_run(Model, slots, flights, ...)
